content: On July 21, 1973, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the New York Mets in a thrilling game at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. In a dramatic finish, Braves outfielder Hank Aaron hit his 700th career home run, becoming just the third player in Major League Baseball history to reach that milestone, joining Babe Ruth and Willie Mays. This achievement solidified Aaron's legacy as one of the greatest hitters in the game and was a significant moment in Braves history, showcasing his enduring talent and impact on the sport.
